definitions.definition: To cause to shine briefly or intermittently.
definitions.example: He flashed the light at the water, trying to see what made the noise.

definitions.definition: To blink; to shine or illuminate intermittently.
definitions.example: The light flashed on and off.

definitions.definition: To be visible briefly.
To make visible briefly.
definitions.example: A number will be flashed on the screen.

definitions.definition: To briefly, and often unintentionally, expose one's naked body or underwear, or part of it, in public. (Contrast streak.)
definitions.example: Her skirt was so short that she flashed her underpants as she was getting out of her car.

definitions.definition: To show or expose an "inappropriate" part of the body to someone for humorous reasons or as an act of contempt.
To break forth like a sudden flood of light; to show a momentary brilliance.
To flaunt; to display in a showy manner.
definitions.example: He flashed a wad of hundred-dollar bills.

definitions.definition: To communicate quickly.
definitions.example: The news services flashed the news about the end of the war to all corners of the globe.

definitions.definition: To move, or cause to move, suddenly.
definitions.example: Flash forward to the present day.

definitions.definition: To telephone a person, only allowing the phone to ring once, in order to request a call back.
definitions.example: Susan flashed Jessica, and then Jessica called her back, because Susan didn't have enough credit on her phone to make the call.

definitions.definition: (of liquid) To evaporate suddenly. (See flash evaporation.)
To climb (a route) successfully on the first attempt.
To write to the memory of (an updatable component such as a BIOS chip or games cartridge).
(glassmaking) To cover with a thin layer, as objects of glass with glass of a different colour.
(glassmaking) To expand (blown glass) into a disc.
To send by some startling or sudden means.
To burst out into violence.
To perform a flash.
To release the pressure from a pressurized vessel.
To trick up in a showy manner.
To strike and throw up large bodies of water from the surface; to splash.
